questions.question: Which of these symmetries occur in nature?

explanations.d: All these symmetries are possible in nature

questions.question: How many centers of symmetry does a simple cube have?

explanations.b: Only the center of the cube is the center of symmetry

questions.question: What is the minimum rotation(in degrees)required for restoring originality in a 4 fold axis of symmetry?

explanations.b: 4 fold symmetry implies minimum angle is 360/4 which is 90 degrees

questions.question: How many 2-fold axes of symmetry does a cube have?

explanations.c: A cube has six 2-fold axes of symmetry

questions.question: How many planes of symmetry does a cube have which do not pass through a vertex

explanations.d: There are three planes of symmetry that do not pass through a vertex

questions.question: How many planes of symmetry does a cube have?

explanations.a: Although it might appear that a cube has 12 planes of symmetry, three of them repeat and hence can be omitted
